intro: Machaeranthera restiformis, commonly known as the prairie smoke, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its unique, feathery flower heads that resemble smoke. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Machaeranthera restiformis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in harsh environments.
